messages.title: Vote Green in 2015
messages.content: The Scottish Green Party stands for an economy for the people and a society for all, and part of a radical alternative to old tired politics of Westminster.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: We'll raise the minimum wage to £10 an hour by 2020
We'll run the railways as a public service and protect other services like the NHS from privatisation
We'll press for more powers for Scotland and for local communities.

housing.content: Encourage investment in affordable housing while protecting green spaces for generations to come.

leaflet.personalStatement: Pat Black lives in west Edinburgh and is passionate about community and democracy, citizenship and social justice. Over the course of a thirty-five year career in Social Care, she has founded a number of radical, locally-focused programs to improve the life experiences of people from marginalised groups.

politicalExperience.achievements: Founder of locally-focused social care programs

images.caption: Vote Green in 2015 leaflet featuring Pat Black for Edinburgh West.

leaflet.additionalNotes: If elected Pat will stand up against welfare cuts and work to repeal bedroom tax and end to benefit sanctions.
